Understand Your Man

Posted by Emma

"Women think men are just hairy, misbehaving women" ~~Alison Armstrong

Well said, Alison. This has got to be one of the best quotes of all time.

It's true, though, isn't it? We don't really understand men. What makes them tick, what matters to them most in the world.

Why don't they listen the way we want them to? Why don't they comfort us when we cry? Why can't they take instruction when it will clearly make things so much easier?

There must be something very wrong with this woman! But, oh right... It's not a woman.

How to Talk About Your Day Without Him Going Mad

Posted by Emma

Question: My boyfriend won’t listen to me talk about my day. When he does, he gets agitated halfway through and never gives me the reactions I am looking for. I feel so frustrated with him! What am I doing wrong?

Answer: This is an excellent question and a common issue among partners.

As a woman, you naturally want to tell your spouse or partner all about your day. We women thrive on sharing our experiences with each other; it’s how we get to feel close and loved.

Posted by Emma

We all love when our partner gets home after a long time of being away, but sometimes the “coming home” ceremony doesn’t go the way we planned. Often, we look forward to having a great evening together, but things seem to go sideways and we end up fighting instead.

Man's Challenge to Multi-Task A Myth?

Posted by Emma

One of the biggest differences in men and women that we have found, is a woman’s ability to do what we call ‘multi-tasking’ – meaning many things at once, and a man’s seeming challenge with it.

Men, on the other hand, have a different ability that is just as important and multi-tasking It comes naturally to them the same way that multi-tasking comes naturally to women. We like to call it by the name that Alison Armstrong came up with: Single Focus.

Single Focused vs. Diffuse Awareness

A man is what we call “single focused.”

4 Simple Steps to Get Your Man to Share His Feelings

Posted by Emma

Our culture has conditioned us to believe that men  have no feelings at all. But in reality that is not true at all – they have as many feelings as any woman.

Why then, do so many women complain that they can’t get their man to open up and share his feelings with them? If men are so deep, why don’t they share their feelings?

This is one of the most common complaints that women have about their husbands. If you also have this complaint, you’ll be happy to learn that there is an answer! Once you learn what works for him, it’s actually easier than you think.

What Men Want in a Woman – How To Get The Right Guy, Without Being Taken Advantage Of

Posted by Emma

There is a common misconception (which was created mainly by pop culture and movies) that men want a certain “type” of woman. Specifically, a particular physical type.

As a result, women often spend fortunes of money on things like anti-aging creams, weight loss gimmicks, makeup, clothing and more to try to become the “perfect woman”.  All so that they will stand a chance, in their mind, at attracting a decent, considerate, loving man.

Understand Why Men Take You Places You Do Not Want To Go

Posted by Emma

Has your guy ever taken you someplace that you really didn’t want to go? You’re sitting there at the sports game or in a sleazy restaurant and thinking, “why would he bring me here of all places?”

This article is about  why guys do this, what to do when you find yourself in this situation, and techniques to make him take you the places that you want to go with him.

Men Presume That They Know What will Make You Happy

Men: Shallow Communicators or Deep Thinkers?

Posted by Emma

There is a common myth in our culture about how men talk and how men think – namely that they’re shallow. They don’t know how to think deeply about an issue and they don’t have opinions on things.

When a woman asks another woman her opinion the 2nd woman will immediately suggest her feelings on the matter – even if it’s something that she doesn’t know so much about.

The reason for this is that women have become accustomed to being judged by their superficial appearance. Therefore in order to not appear ignorant a woman might suggest an answer.

Why Hinting Does not Work - And What You Should Do Instead

Posted by Emma

There a number of reasons why we pick the partners we do. Part of the reason that a woman is attracted to a particular man is because he has characteristics that make her feel safe – that she’s going to be taken care of. These characteristics can fuzz out other elements of his personality.

As the relationship deepens and she gets to know him better she’ll see past that initial image to the real, full person that he is. She might then find what she considers flaws and she’ll comment on them hoping to fix him.

How Women Criticize
